intro: Mascagnia seleriana, commonly known as the yellow bellflower, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the Apocynaceae family and is characterized by its showy, bell-shaped yellow flowers. The plant typically grows as a shrub or small tree, reaching heights of up to 3 meters. Its leaves are opposite, ovate, and often have a waxy texture. The flowers bloom in clusters, attracting pollinators such as birds and insects.
